str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 2nd Person Plural
str2: Your, yours. From humeis; yours, i.e. Pertaining to you.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From meta and lambano; to participate; genitive case, to accept.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Hair (of the head or of animals). Genitive case trichos, etc. of uncertain derivation; hair.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
